skill.name: postmortem-writing
skill.description: Write effective blameless postmortems with root cause analysis, timelines, and action items. Use when conducting incident reviews, writing postmortem documents, or improving incident response processes.
skill.summary: Write effective blameless postmortems with root cause analysis, timelines, and action items. Use whe...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing markdown guides and templates for writing postmortems. No executable code, file access, network calls, or system capabilities are present.

content.value_statement: Writing effective postmortems helps teams learn from incidents and prevent recurrence. This skill provides templates, frameworks, and guidance for conducting blameless postmortems that drive organizational learning.
actual_capabilities: Generate comprehensive postmortem documents with standard structure
Apply the 5 Whys framework for root cause analysis
Create actionable timelines from incident events
Draft prioritized action items with owners and due dates
Identify contributing factors and systemic improvements
limitations: Does not access incident management systems or ticketing tools
Does not integrate with monitoring or alerting platforms
Requires users to provide incident details and timeline events
Does not automatically detect or import incident data

use_cases.title: Document production incidents
use_cases.description: Create structured postmortems for SEV1 and SEV2 incidents to capture learnings and drive system improvements.

use_cases.title: Lead incident reviews
use_cases.description: Facilitate blameless postmortem meetings that focus on systemic improvements rather than individual blame.

use_cases.title: Track action items
use_cases.description: Generate prioritized action items with clear owners and due dates to ensure incident follow-through.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Postmortem
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a quick postmortem for a [brief incident description] that lasted [duration]. Include what happened, timeline, root cause, immediate fix, and one lesson learned.

prompt_templates.title: Standard Postmortem
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a comprehensive postmortem for [incident name]. Include executive summary, detailed timeline with UTC times, root cause analysis using 5 Whys, impact assessment, what worked, what could improve, and prioritized action items with owners.

prompt_templates.title: Root Cause Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply the 5 Whys analysis to [incident description]. Start with the problem statement and drill down to identify at least 3 root causes. For each root cause, suggest a systemic improvement.

prompt_templates.title: Action Item Draft
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this incident summary [paste summary] and generate 5 action items. Prioritize them P0 to P2. Include a brief description, suggested owner role, and realistic due date for each item.

output_examples.input: Write a postmortem for a database connection exhaustion incident that affected our payment service for 47 minutes.
output: ## Postmortem: Payment Service Database Connection Exhaustion
**Impact**: 12,000 customers unable to complete purchases, $45,000 revenue loss
## Root Cause: v2.3.4 deployment bypassed connection pool, causing direct connections per request
## 5 Whys: Database exhausted â†’ New connections per request â†’ Code bypassed pool â†’ Developer unfamiliar with patterns â†’ No documentation
## Action Items: Add integration tests (P0), lower alert threshold (P0), document patterns (P1)

best_practices: Start writing the postmortem within 24-48 hours while details are fresh
Include specific times, metrics, and evidence rather than vague descriptions
Focus on systemic improvements rather than individual actions or mistakes
Always create action items with clear owners and measurable outcomes
anti_patterns: Naming individuals as causes instead of examining system conditions
Skipping small incidents that could reveal patterns across the organization
Creating action items without owners, due dates, or tracking mechanisms
Ending the postmortem without sharing learnings across the organization

faq.question: What severity incidents need postmortems?
faq.answer: SEV1 and SEV2 incidents, outages over 15 minutes, data loss, security incidents, and near-misses all warrant postmortems.

faq.question: How long should a postmortem take to write?
faq.answer: A quick postmortem takes 30 minutes. A comprehensive postmortem typically requires 2-4 hours including the review meeting.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with our incident management tools?
faq.answer: The skill operates through conversation. Users paste incident details or manually transfer information to their ticketing system.

faq.question: Is the data shared with external services?
faq.answer: No external calls are made. All processing happens within the AI conversation. No incident data leaves your environment.

faq.question: How is this different from ChatGPT or other AI tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides structured templates, the 5 Whys framework, and domain-specific guidance for postmortem best practices.

faq.question: What makes a postmortem blameless?
faq.answer: Focus on system conditions and processes, not individual mistakes. Ask what allowed the error rather than who made it.
